title: Analysis of piecewise function graph part - c

content.question: Is there a value of a,−4≤a<6 , for which the Mean Value Theorem, applied to the interval [a, 6], guarantees a value c, a<c<6, at which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>c</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C67@</annotation> </semantics> </math>? Justify your answer.
